{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3639085,"name":"Sreyan Das","username":"sdas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sdas/{size}/242589_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-29T00:14:20.432Z","cooked":"

The radio SYS light is flashing 50Hz forever. The documentation states that this SYS light flash indicates it is starting its “first successful boot” but it has been doing this for like 20 minutes. We tried confirming that all other things are setup correctly (access point appears in DS) and we confirmed both ones said successful to the radio check status. We have tried re flashing and everything. Can anyone help with this issue?

Ensure 2.4ghz Ap switch is on

This appears to be not useful troubleshooting - OP mentions BOTH radios indicating they are using one as an AP and the other as a robot radio and the 6GHz band, no 2.4 needed.

OP can you reach both config pages at their respective IP’s or the fallback IP’s?

Are you using the network config tool?

Did you set SSIDs and WPA keys on both the same?

We can reach both config pages. Im pretty sure the SSID and WPA keys are the same on both. But we can confirm tomorrow.

If you still can’t get it to work, contact WCP customer service at support@wcproducts.com

We had one radio that was stuck in a boot loop, and they helped us fix it remotely.
